title: Galatians Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Galatians with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 6 chapters.

questions.question: Who is the author of the book of Galatians?
questions.explanation: Paul identifies himself as the author of the epistle to the Galatians.

questions.question: In Galatians 1:6, Paul expresses amazement because the Galatians are turning to what?
questions.explanation: Paul marvels that the Galatians are so soon removed from him who called them to another gospel.

questions.question: According to Galatians 1:8, what happens to anyone who preaches a gospel other than the one Paul preached?
questions.explanation: Paul states that even if an angel preaches another gospel, let him be accursed.

questions.question: How did Paul receive the gospel he preached, according to Galatians 1:12?
questions.explanation: Paul received the gospel not from man, but by the revelation of Jesus Christ.

questions.question: Before becoming an apostle, what was Paul's attitude toward the church, as stated in Galatians 1:13?
questions.explanation: Paul says he persecuted the church of God beyond measure.

questions.question: How long after his conversion did Paul visit Jerusalem to see Peter, according to Galatians 1:18?
questions.explanation: Paul states he went up to Jerusalem after three years to see Peter.

questions.question: Who was the only other apostle Paul saw at Jerusalem during his first visit, as mentioned in Galatians 1:19?
questions.explanation: Paul mentions he saw no other apostles except James, the Lord's brother.

questions.question: In Galatians 2:1, how many years after Paul's conversion did he go up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas?
questions.explanation: Paul states he went up to Jerusalem again fourteen years later.

questions.question: Who accompanied Paul and Barnabas to Jerusalem in Galatians 2:1?
questions.explanation: Titus was taken along by Paul and Barnabas to Jerusalem.

questions.question: What issue did Paul confront Peter about in Antioch, as described in Galatians 2:11?
questions.explanation: Paul withstood Peter to his face because he withdrew from eating with Gentiles fearing the circumcision party.

questions.question: According to Galatians 2:16, how is a man justified?
questions.explanation: Paul teaches justification is through faith in Jesus Christ, not by works of the law.

questions.question: What does Paul say about the law in Galatians 2:19?
options: I am dead to the law
questions.correctAnswer: I am dead to the law
questions.explanation: Paul states he is dead to the law so that he may live unto God.

questions.question: What is the key message of Galatians 3:11?
options: The just shall live by faith
The law is the way to life
questions.correctAnswer: The just shall live by faith
questions.explanation: Paul quotes scripture to show justification comes by faith, not by law.

questions.question: In Galatians 3:13, what did Christ do for us concerning the curse of the law?
options: Redeemed us by being made a curse
questions.correctAnswer: Redeemed us by being made a curse
questions.explanation: Christ redeemed us from the curse by being made a curse for us on the tree.

questions.question: According to Galatians 3:28, which distinctions are abolished in Christ?
options: Jew nor Greek, bond nor free, male nor female
Rich nor poor, slave nor free
questions.correctAnswer: Jew nor Greek, bond nor free, male nor female
questions.explanation: In Christ, all such distinctions are erased; all are one.

questions.question: Galatians 4:4 says God sent forth His Son at what time?
questions.explanation: God sent His Son when the time was fully come.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Christ being made under the law in Galatians 4:4-5?
options: To redeem them under the law and receive adoption
questions.correctAnswer: To redeem them under the law and receive adoption
questions.explanation: Christ came to redeem those under the law so we might receive adoption as sons.

questions.question: In Galatians 4:6, what has God sent into the hearts of believers?
questions.explanation: God sent the Spirit of His Son into believers' hearts, crying, Abba, Father.

questions.question: Galatians 5:1 says Christ has set us free for what purpose?
options: That we should stand fast and not be entangled again with a yoke of bondage
questions.correctAnswer: That we should stand fast and not be entangled again with a yoke of bondage
questions.explanation: Christ's freedom is to stand firm and not be burdened again by the law.

questions.question: What is the 'fruit of the Spirit' listed in Galatians 5:22-23?
options: Love, joy, peace, longsuffering, gentleness, goodness, faith, meekness, temperance
questions.correctAnswer: Love, joy, peace, longsuffering, gentleness, goodness, faith, meekness, temperance
questions.explanation: Paul enumerates these qualities as the fruit of the Spirit.

questions.question: According to Galatians 6:7, what principle does Paul teach about sowing and reaping?
options: What a man sows, he shall also reap
questions.correctAnswer: What a man sows, he shall also reap
questions.explanation: Paul teaches a man will reap according to what he sows.

questions.question: Who does Paul say should bear one another's burdens in Galatians 6:2?
questions.explanation: Paul instructs believers to bear one another's burdens.

questions.question: True or False: In Galatians 2:3, Titus was compelled to be circumcised.
questions.explanation: Titus, being a Greek, was not compelled to be circumcised.

questions.question: True or False: Paul says in Galatians 3:3 that those who began in the Spirit can be made perfect by the flesh.
questions.explanation: Paul asks if they are foolish to think they can be made perfect by the flesh after starting in the Spirit.

questions.question: True or False: According to Galatians 4:9, the Galatians desire to be in bondage again to weak and beggarly elements.
questions.explanation: Paul expresses concern that they desire again to be in bondage to weak and beggarly elements.

questions.question: True or False: Paul states in Galatians 5:6 that neither circumcision nor uncircumcision has any value, but faith working through love.
questions.explanation: Faith operative through love is what counts, not circumcision status.

questions.question: True or False: In Galatians 6:14, Paul boasts in the law of Moses.
questions.explanation: Paul boasts only in the cross of Christ, not the law.

questions.question: True or False: Galatians 3:19 teaches that the law was added because of transgressions until the seed should come.
questions.explanation: The law served as a temporary measure until Christ, the promised seed, came.

questions.question: True or False: Galatians 6:9 encourages believers to grow weary in well doing.
questions.explanation: Paul urges believers not to be weary in well doing.

questions.question: True or False: According to Galatians 2:20, Paul lives by the faith of the Son of God, who loved him and gave himself for him.
questions.explanation: Paul expresses that his life is lived by faith in Christ's love and sacrifice.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Complete this verse: "For ye are all the children of God by _______ in Christ Jesus."
questions.explanation: Paul teaches that all believers are children of God by faith in Christ.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Complete this verse: "Christ hath redeemed us from the curse of the law, being made a curse for us: for it is written, Cursed is every one that _______ on a tree:"
questions.explanation: Christ was made a curse by hanging on a tree, fulfilling the law's curse.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Complete this verse: "I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I, but _______ liveth in me:"
questions.explanation: Paul describes his new life as Christ living in him.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Complete this verse: "Bear ye one another's ______, and so fulfil the law of Christ."
questions.explanation: Believers are commanded to bear each other's burdens.

questions.question: Which false teaching was Paul combating in Galatians?
options: That Gentile believers must be circumcised
That Jesus was not the Messiah
questions.correctAnswer: That Gentile believers must be circumcised
questions.explanation: Paul opposed Judaizers who taught Gentiles must be circumcised to be saved.

questions.question: What metaphor does Paul use in Galatians 4:24 to explain the two covenants?
options: Two women: one bondmaid and one freewoman
Two trees: one good and one bad
Two cities: one earthly and one heavenly
questions.correctAnswer: Two women: one bondmaid and one freewoman
questions.explanation: Paul uses the allegory of Hagar and Sarah to explain the covenants.

questions.question: Who were the 'pillars' in the Jerusalem church mentioned in Galatians 2:9?
questions.explanation: These three were considered pillars of the church at Jerusalem.

questions.question: According to Galatians 3:7, who are considered the children of Abraham?
questions.explanation: Faith, not law or ethnicity, makes one a child of Abraham.

questions.question: What warning does Paul give about sowing to the flesh in Galatians 6:8?
questions.explanation: Sowing to the flesh results in corruption, while sowing to the Spirit leads to life.

questions.question: According to Galatians 5:16, what should believers do to not fulfill the lust of the flesh?
questions.explanation: Walking in the Spirit prevents fulfilling the flesh's lusts.

questions.question: Galatians 3:24 calls the law our what, to bring us unto Christ?
questions.explanation: The law was a schoolmaster to lead us to Christ.

questions.question: What fruit of the Spirit in Galatians 5 is associated with self-control?
questions.explanation: Temperance means self-control, one of the fruit of the Spirit.

questions.question: In Galatians 1:10, Paul asks if he now persuades men or God, meaning he seeks to please whom?
questions.explanation: Paul emphasizes that he seeks to please God, not men.

questions.question: What does Paul say about boasting in Galatians 6:14?
options: He will boast only in the cross of Christ
questions.correctAnswer: He will boast only in the cross of Christ
questions.explanation: Paul will boast only in Christ crucified.

questions.question: According to Galatians 3:28, in Christ there is neither Jew nor Greek, bond nor free, male nor female: what does this signify?
questions.explanation: All distinctions are abolished; believers are one in Christ.
